questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the Tomasulo algorithm?

answers.a: To improve cache performance in multiprocessor systems
answers.b: To enable out-of-order execution while maintaining program correctness
answers.c: To reduce the number of pipeline stages in a processor

explanations.a: Incorrect. The Tomasulo algorithm is focused on instruction scheduling, not cache performance.
explanations.b: Correct. The Tomasulo algorithm enables dynamic scheduling and out-of-order execution while preserving program semantics through register renaming.
explanations.c: Incorrect. The algorithm doesn't aim to reduce pipeline stages.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Branch prediction is a separate technique from dynamic scheduling.

questions.question: What are reservation stations used for in the Tomasulo algorithm?

answers.a: To store instructions waiting for execution and implement register renaming
answers.b: To cache frequently accessed data from memory
answers.c: To predict which branches will be taken

explanations.a: Correct. Reservation stations buffer instructions waiting for their operands and provide the mechanism for register renaming.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Reservation stations are not data caches.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Branch prediction is handled by different hardware.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Virtual memory translation is handled by the MMU.

questions.question: What does register renaming achieve in the Tomasulo algorithm?

answers.a: It increases the number of architectural registers
answers.b: It eliminates false dependencies between instructions
answers.c: It speeds up memory access operations
answers.d: It reduces the number of functional units needed

explanations.a: Incorrect. Register renaming doesn't change the number of architectural registers.
explanations.b: Correct. Register renaming eliminates false dependencies (WAR and WAW hazards) by mapping architectural registers to reservation station tags.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Register renaming doesn't directly affect memory access speed.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Register renaming doesn't reduce functional unit requirements.

questions.question: Which types of hazards does register renaming eliminate?

answers.d: All types of data hazards including RAW

explanations.a: Incorrect. RAW hazards are true dependencies that cannot be eliminated.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Register renaming eliminates both WAR and WAW hazards.
explanations.c: Correct. Register renaming eliminates false dependencies (WAR and WAW) while preserving true dependencies (RAW).
explanations.d: Incorrect. RAW hazards represent true data dependencies that must be preserved.

questions.question: What is the role of the Common Data Bus (CDB) in the Tomasulo algorithm?

answers.a: To transfer instructions from memory to the processor
answers.b: To broadcast computed results to all reservation stations simultaneously
answers.c: To handle cache misses and memory operations
answers.d: To coordinate between multiple processor cores

explanations.a: Incorrect. The CDB is not used for instruction fetching.
explanations.b: Correct. The CDB broadcasts results from functional units to all reservation stations that might be waiting for those values.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Memory operations are handled by load/store units, not the CDB directly.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The CDB operates within a single processor core.

questions.question: In the Tomasulo algorithm, when can an instruction begin execution?

answers.a: As soon as it is issued to a reservation station
answers.b: Only after all previous instructions have completed
answers.c: When all of its operands are available (no pending dependencies)
answers.d: After a fixed number of clock cycles

explanations.a: Incorrect. Instructions must wait for their operands to become available.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This would be in-order execution, not out-of-order.
explanations.c: Correct. Instructions can begin execution as soon as all their operands are ready, enabling out-of-order execution.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Execution timing depends on operand availability, not fixed delays.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes a structural hazard in the context of the Tomasulo algorithm?

answers.a: When two instructions try to write to the same register
answers.b: When an instruction needs a result that hasn't been computed yet
answers.c: When there are no available reservation stations for a new instruction
answers.d: When the branch predictor makes an incorrect prediction

explanations.a: Incorrect. This describes a WAW hazard, which is eliminated by register renaming.
explanations.b: Incorrect. This describes a RAW hazard or true dependency.
explanations.c: Correct. A structural hazard occurs when hardware resources (like reservation stations) are not available.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Branch mispredictions are control hazards, not structural hazards.

questions.question: What was the original motivation for developing the Tomasulo algorithm at IBM?

answers.b: To handle floating-point operations with variable execution times
answers.c: To reduce power consumption in processors

explanations.a: Incorrect. The algorithm was designed for single-processor performance.
explanations.b: Correct. The IBM 360/91 needed to handle floating-point operations with widely varying execution times efficiently.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Power consumption was not a primary concern in the 1960s.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The focus was on instruction scheduling, not cache performance.

questions.question: How does the Tomasulo algorithm handle Write-After-Write (WAW) hazards?

answers.a: By stalling the pipeline until the first write completes
answers.b: By using register renaming to assign different reservation station tags
answers.c: By executing writes in program order only
answers.d: By canceling the earlier write operation

explanations.a: Incorrect. Stalling would reduce performance and is not necessary.
explanations.b: Correct. Register renaming ensures that different writes use different reservation station tags, eliminating the false dependency.
explanations.c: Incorrect. This would prevent out-of-order execution benefits.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Both writes may be legitimate and needed by different instructions.
